Topic.Title: Expression syntax, how to consider object name? (Solved)

Posts.EditableText:
I need to know how to say something as a Quest expression, because there is no option for it in the 'IF' list

The command using this expression is: kiss #object#

I want to express:

IF the [NAME/ALIAS] of given #object# is "specific object.name" THEN (blahblahblah script effects)

Can anyone help me?
Posts.HTML:
I need to know how to say something as a Quest expression, because there is no option for it in the 'IF' list

The command using this expression is: kiss #object#

I want to express:

IF the [NAME/ALIAS] of given #object# is "specific object.name" THEN (blahblahblah script effects)

Can anyone help me?

Posts.EditableText: The expression is probably object = name of object … a bare word in Quest script can either be a local variable (such as `object` within a command script), or the name of an object. So you can use the `=` operator to test if those refer to the same object.
Posts.HTML: The expression is probably object = name of object … a bare word in Quest script can either be a local variable (such as object within a command script), or the name of an object. So you can use the = operator to test if those refer to the same object.

Posts.EditableText: that seems to work perfectly! thank you!
Posts.HTML: that seems to work perfectly! thank you!
